intro: Daucus laserpitioides var. stenopterus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved parsley. It is a flowering plant native to the western United States, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
